summary: This bill, the Central Coast Heritage Protection Act, designates certain federal lands in California as wilderness areas, scenic areas, and Wild and Scenic Rivers. It also mandates studies on a national scenic trail, a new vehicle trail, and nonmotorized recreation opportunities. The bill addresses management of these areas, including fire control, grazing, and access for Tribal members. Furthermore, it establishes a Fox Mountain Special Management Area with specific regulations and withdrawal provisions, impacting land use and resource management.
